The Grand/Cicero South elevator
The Grand/Cicero South elevator is out of service. Customers can use Western avenue or Hanson Park as alternate boarding stations. Updates will be provided.
https://metrarail.com/maps-schedules/train-lines/MD-N?Twitter=1&Email=1&SMS=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&gtfsrt=1
MDN2615- Delayed Departure
MDN train #2615, scheduled to arrive Fox Lake at 6:12 p.m., will be delayed in departure due to earlier police activity. Metra will update you when this train is on the move.
https://metrarail.com/maps-schedules/train-lines/ME?Twitter=1&Email=1&SMS=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&gtfsrt=1
MED Elevator Out of Service
Metra Electric Millennium Station elevator is out of service. Alternative accessible locations are South Water Street Entrance and Van Buren Street.
https://metrarail.com/maps-schedules/train-lines/MD-N?Twitter=1&Email=1&SMS=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&gtfsrt=1
Grayslake Platform Construction

Platform construction at the Grayslake station will prohibit boarding on the west end of the platform. This will restrict boarding using the center pedestrian crossing. During this time, passengers will have to go to Lake street to cross and board trains.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert ME - Homewood East Side Construction Will Begin March 13

Beginning Monday, March 13, access to the Homewood Station from the east will be closed for station construction until Summer 2024.  Access to the boarding platform will be through the Park Avenue entrance ONLY (west side of tracks).

 

Beginning, Monday, March 6, the Pace bus stop will relocate from Harwood Avenue to Park Avenue.  Please allow additional time and use caution near the work zone.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=0
Metra Alert BNSF - Attention Berwyn Commuters: Starting July 5, 2023, Stanley Avenue will be under construction for approximately 14 weeks.
Attention Berwyn Commuters: Starting July 5, 2023, Stanley Avenue will be under construction for approximately 14 weeks. Please use caution through the work zone and allow extra travel time.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=0
Metra Alert ME - 79th street/Chatham Station Closure Beginning July 10 - Station Rebuild Project

The 79th street/Chatham station on the Metra Electric line will be closed beginning Monday, July 10 for approximately 7 months. During this time passengers can use 75th and 83rd street stations as alternatives. This is part of the Metra Electric Community initiative to transform multiple stations on the Metra Electric District. Once completed, stations will have enclosed ADA-accessible street-level entrances, lobbies with elevators, new stairs, headhouses, new composite deck platforms, new lighting, and signage.  For more information click here.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=0
Metra Alert ME - Metra to add trains to ME Blue Island Service.

Beginning Aug. 14, four trains will be added to the Metra Electric Line’s Blue Island Branch schedule. Electric Line riders on all branches will also see minor changes to the existing train schedule to better reflect operating conditions, click here.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=0
Metra Alert UP-N - Track construction Saturday, August 12 through Sunday, August 13

Track construction will be taking place Saturday, August 12 through midday Sunday,  August 13. Trains may incur delays enroute up to 20 minutes behind schedule passing through the work zone. Please listen to announcements for any platform changes. For additional information visit metra.com/constructionnotices.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=0
Metra Alert ME - Limited Parking at Olympia Fields Station August 14-20

The 2023 BMW Championship will be held August 14-20 at Olympia Fields Country Club, which is adjacent to the Metra station. During the tournament, there will be limited parking available at the Olympia Fields station. The south portion of the parking lot will be reserved the use of the golf tournament. The north portion of the parking lot will remain open with 207 commuter parking spaces available for Metra customers. Commuters are advised to give themselves additional time to park at the station throughout the week, or to use the Flossmoor or 211st stations to access Metra service.
